attributes.action: Remove Chris Brown’s ban from the U.K. and allow him access to the country.
attributes.background: Global sensation and pop-culture figure, Chris Brown was publicly banned from entering the United Kingdom in 2009 following his domestic abuse and violent history towards then girlfriend, Rihanna. I believe that the ban should be lifted almost 10 years on so Brown can come and perform in the U.K.
attributes.additional_details: My knowledge from the Daily Mail and love for Chris Brown are my references.

attributes.action: Recoup NHS treatment costs from anyone convicted of domestic violence offences.
attributes.background: My plan would be to use the U.K. Courts system to recoup the costs of treating domestic violence victims by applying an additional financial penalty (to anyone convicted of domestic violence) that fully covers the costs of any NHS treatment that arises as a result of a person’s criminal act.
attributes.additional_details:
Every year, it is estimated, that it costs the NHS approximately £5.5 billions Sterling to treat victims of domestic violence.Please See link below.
https://www.trustforlondon.org.uk/news/domestic-violence-costs-55bn-year-england/
Surely these NHS treatment costs could be recouped from anyone convicted of an offence of domestic violence or abuse by using the U.K Law Courts to apply an additional financial penalty to perpetrators of domestic violence offences?

attributes.action: Prohibit filibustering and similar forms of sabotage to the democratic process.
attributes.background: Certain MPs have been subverting democracy by using filibustering and other procedural technicalities to prevent reasoned intellectual debate of bills in the House of Commons. This is an affront to the parliamentary process and brings our country’s politics into disrepute.

attributes.action: Cut Overseas Aid budget by 50% & give £7bn saved to NHS, rather than more taxes.
attributes.background: UK commits to UN target that each country gives 0.7% of GNI (Gross National Income) for Overseas Aid. Only 6 (inc UK) of the 28 participants achieve target - average for all is 0.30% - (OECD 2015). UK pays c10% of total - ie £14bn of £140bn. As NHS is in need, £7bn could save it. Charity at home!
attributes.additional_details:
Source 2015 OECD.

The other 5 countries hitting the target are: Netherlands, Denmark, Luxembourg, Norway and Sweden - all relatively small economies, with positive attitudes to aid.  

The other members of the G8 seem to have an alternative attitude: USA 0.17%, Japan 0.22%, Russia 0%, Canada 0.28%, Italy 0.21%, Germany 0.52%, France 0.37%.

If we went to half of what we currently pay, we'd still be achieving 0.35%; still more than all other G8 members apart from Germany and, marginally, France.

attributes.action: End any form of Monarchy in the UK and end all payments to the Royal Family.
attributes.background: Considering the financial state of the UK and with costs being cut left, right and centre is it perhaps time we cut one of the largest expenses? The Queen receives a HUGE payment from the tax payers of the United Kingdom on top of profits made from her own private lands. Both in the millions.
attributes.additional_details:
The Royal Family spend millions on travel, renovations and many luxuries. These costs don't include the hiring of security, among other things such as Royal Weddings. 
https://www.theguardian.com/uk-news/2017/jun/27/queens-income-rises-to-82m-to-cover-cost-of-buckingham-palace-works
https://www.coventrytelegraph.net/news/coventry-news/how-much-royal-family-cost-14111218

attributes.action: Please keep our Island Studio school OPEN in East Cowes Isle of Wight
attributes.background:
Do NOT CLOSE this school. 
If the current proprietors cannot or will not continue running it, then allow SOMEONE ELSE to run it.
We need diversity of opportunity.
But start at a lower age so children can choose to go to have their full secondary education at this school. Make it 11-19, not 14-19.

attributes.action: Ensure money raised from new sugar levy is divided between education and the NHS
attributes.background:
The Government recently introduced the sugar levy on soft drinks to try and tackle the growing problem of obesity in the UK. The legislation doesn’t specify where the money raised should be spent.
We would like legislation created to ensure that any money raised is given to the NHS and to education
attributes.additional_details: The levy on soft drinks is expected to raise over £274 million pounds which could be used to help fund the struggling NHS budget and also fund sport activities for school children.

attributes.action: Utility companies to be responsible for repairing potholes around poor repairs
attributes.background: A majority of potholes form around places of existing weakness, such as road repair works following companies digging up the roads for routine maintenance.  These companies should be responsible for filling any potholes that are a consequence of a road weakness following their actions
attributes.additional_details:
Potholes are caused when water penetrates cracks in the road. When this water freezes, it expands, widening the cracks. When it melts, traffic smashes new craters into the road surface.  Other countries do not have many drains and services under their roads, and do not give privatised utility companies the right to dig up a new road
An increasing number of road users are taking legal action. The AA estimates that the cost to insurers of claims (pothole damage) was £2.85m during February alone.

attributes.action: Increase the defence budget to strengthen and build up the UK's Armed Forces.
attributes.background: The UK needs to strengthen and build up it's Armed Forces in order to be able to counter any threat to the Nation and to better its capabilities as a part of NATO.

attributes.action: Bring Back Capital Punishment For Convicted Terrorists.
attributes.background:
Over 30 lives have been claimed in attacks in the UK since 2016 which has left the UK terrified.
Anyone that performs terrorist attacks against the UK should be faced with capital punishment once proven guilty.
Many citizens of the UK feel a life sentence in prison isn't enough to satisfy justice.

attributes.action: Make self defence part of the physical education curriculum
attributes.background: With more and more assaults and the increase of knife crime, I think it should be mandatory that schools teach their students self defence.
attributes.additional_details: In 2017, there were just under 39,600 recorded offences involving the use of a knife or sharp instrument in England and Wales. That’s the highest level recorded over a year since comparable figures began in 2011.

attributes.action: Allow the public to carry and use self defence items.
attributes.background: Request that in light of significant police cuts, a steep the increase in violent crime, and a reduction in detection and convictions for violent crime, that citizens be permitted to defend themselves against attackers without fear of prosecution.
attributes.additional_details: To this end, we request that for as long as the current criminal climate exists, that we be permitted to carry items that can be used for, and are intended for self defence, such as night sticks, batons, pepper spray as well as other non lethal items. We feel that the need to adequately defend ourselves and our families becomes a basic right when the police and judicial system are unable to fulfil that duty as is the case at present.

attributes.action: Change 30 free hour childcare to a monthly sign-up and not a term sign-up.
attributes.background: Parents who get a full time job need to then put their child into care immediately, so need the support immediately and not on a term by term basis, you can't sign up when you don't have a job but when you do, you have to wait until the new term starts. If this was monthly it would make sense.

attributes.action: Ban the sale of disposable BBQs in the UK
attributes.background:
Disposable BBQs are bad for the environment in terms of use & disposal

Are made using unsustainable materials from tropical forests in South Africa and South America
Can't be recycled
Burn the grass & typically result it scattered litter
Local residents are unable to open windows
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.hackneycitizen.co.uk/2018/03/21/hackney-council-cracks-down-bbqs-london-fields/

http://news.hackney.gov.uk/london-fields-disposable-barbecue-ban

https://www.telegraph.co.uk/culture/3666716/Is-it-worth-it-Disposable-barbecues.html

attributes.action: Pass a law requiring NHS Trusts to release patient records within 21 days
attributes.background: Currently, there are significant variations between NHS trusts as to how long they will take to release patient records when requested. We, the undersigned, call on the government to standardise this in law to 21 days, as for many people accessing their medical records is potentially time critical

attributes.action: Introduce a new system to ensure that roads are maintained to a safe standard.
attributes.background: Despite a legal requirement for roads to be maintained to a safe standard, highway authorities have been allowed to put lives at risk by letting many roads become unsafe. Urgent action is needed now to remedy this and a new system needed to prevent this from happening in the future.
attributes.additional_details: Legislation and guidance on road maintenance lie with the Highways Act 1980 and the Well-Maintained Highways: Code of Practice, respectively. Both these require that roads should be maintained in a safe condition but this is clearly not happening. Individuals can go through the process of suing for damage or injury but this has proved inadequate in preventing roads being allowed to deteriorate into a dangerous state. There is a clear lack of accountability and an absence of desire on behalf of the government to implement the requirements of existing legislation and guidance. A new system is therefore required to ensure that safe standards are set and that these standards are met.

attributes.action: Repeal the 1997 handgun amendment act & legalise conceal-carry.
attributes.background: The signatories of this petition want to see handguns, rifles & shotguns treated like any other dangerous tool; available to law-abiding citizens in the same way cars are; with licensing & training to all who desire them for self-defence. The time has come.

attributes.action: Publish details of the preparations taken in case of ‘no deal’ exit from the EU
attributes.background: The Government has shelved plans to publish details of planing for a no deal exit.  These plans will affect everyone in the UK and therefore it is within the public interest to see these plans.  This petition calls on the government to publish the plans allowing the public to see the preparations

attributes.action: Pay student social workers on Placement a minimum wage
attributes.background: Pay a basic living wage to social work students who have to do 37.5 hours on placement. Students should receive a fair wage to help support them during their studies as part time work is not always an option and so money is very tight.
attributes.additional_details: University students who have homes/families and bills to pay struggle to maintain a life on a social work bursary. The placement funding does not cover the miles or the hours driving from one clients house to another over 100 days. Most students rely on family members and friends for handouts and childcare to get through the 20 weeks of unpaid work,doing the same role as social workers on £28,000 a year and up in order to qualify with an MA.

attributes.action: Vaccinate all children against Chickenpox
attributes.background: The last four days I have watched my two daughters scream in agony as their Chickenpox became itchy and painful. People presuppose Chickenpox is a mild infection but that is not always the case. It is about time that we eliminated this illness and added it to the childhood immunisation schedule.
attributes.additional_details:
It is assumed that Chickenpox is a mild virus that does not require vaccination. However, this is not always the case and secondary infection can result which can lead to hospital admission and even fatality. The NHS website outlines this in more clinical detail. Another important factor is the sheer anguish and suffering of those who catch it. Chickepox is very itchy and painful and most children find it extremely distressing. When a vaccine is available, would we not choose to eliminate this suffering?
In other countries such as the US and Australia, a vaccine is offered as part of the childhood immunisation schedule. Let us not let cost stop us eliminating this horrible illness once and for all.

attributes.action: Implement transitional employment for service leavers and veterans
attributes.background: Service leavers and veterans are currently discharged from service with no guarantee of transitional employment that would allow time for decompression of physical/mental health recovery. Service can be a long period of institutionalised pattern setting for veterans. There is a need for adjustment.
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.mirror.co.uk/news/uk-news/former-soldier-mp-says-veterans-12084010

http://www.dailymail.co.uk/news/article-5426377/Freed-Royal-Marine-Alexander-Blackman-gets-new-job.html

Veterans make up 1 in 10 of the UK populous, we have upto 10000 in the HM prison service and 7,000 rough sleeping, about 170,000 working age veterans are unemployed or economically inactive with a veteran suicide every two weeks!

We need a significant change in support services!

attributes.action: Classify professional avoidable negligence as a criminal act
attributes.background: Of course mistakes happen, but too many are avoidable, and are classified as 'civil'. Many are not subject to criminal investigation, when sometimes this should be the case. 'Individuals' should also be held accountable. This would be a deterrent and lower the authority compensation liability.
attributes.additional_details: Professionals with a duty of care be it medical, social care, community or residential care that cause avoidable physical or mental harm, abuse, neglect or death through direct involvement and incorrect decision making, should be fully investigated through the justice system and the crown prosecution service and charged with criminal neglect. The logic is that it would encourage professionals to think twice and provide a strong deterrent when making hasty, rash and bias life changing decisions.

attributes.action: Allow RSPCA to seize animals that they believe to be in danger
attributes.background:
The police have to be there for the RSPCA to seize an animal, because of this it is a lot of time wasted for the Police force. 

RSPCA are educated on these situations and should be allowed to go ahead and take any animal they believe to be in danger without the authorities.
attributes.additional_details: Not being able to take an animal that is in danger can cause harm to the animal and sometimes this becomes fatal and there will be a court case, which also is a lot of wasted money when it could have been avoided.

attributes.action: Make UK standard parking spaces bigger.
attributes.background: Parking space is a premium in most cities and towns. However, most spaces are barely wider than a vehicle. A UK standard parking space is 2.4m wide, by 4.8m. The average family car is 2.1m x 4.8m. Park perfectly and you get 150mm either side to open a door. This is not enough for most vehicle users.
attributes.additional_details:
You should be able to park your vehicle and get in or out without struggling. You should also not have to worry about potential damage which can often be sustained in your absence. Causing needless cost and loss of earnings, maybe even insurance hikes. Town and city planners have overlooked this for years, as have Supermarkets and retail parks.
It's time, as consumers, that we took a stand and put the onus onto those profiting from our misery.
Your vote could help to change this.

attributes.action: Make it law that it is reported to the police when a cat is knocked down.
attributes.background: Unlike the current laws regarding dogs, it is NOT required to report the knocking down of a cat. Not only is it unfair, but also cruel. A cat has as much right as a dog, however, they are not given the same kindness and protection of the current laws of our lands.

attributes.action: Encourage schools to expell students who are bullying others.
attributes.background: All across the world, students are bullied in school. However, this is increasing dramatically. Head teachers should be encouraged to expel students who are bullying other students, as the victims often do not feel safe while the bullies are around.
attributes.additional_details: Young people/students have enough school related stress to deal with such as exams and coursework. Being bullied can affect their grades, their self esteem and in a lot of cases, their lives. Schools should be encouraged to expel individuals who bully others, out of respect for the victims. Many young people do not feel safe in school due to bullying, and this must stop altogether.

attributes.action: Revoke all Diplomatic and Economic ties with South Africa
attributes.background: Due to the actions of the current ANC leadership, I would like to see the same type of action taken as was put in place against the National Party in the 70’s and 80’s. The ANC needs to be put under pressure for the welfare of ALL South Africans.

attributes.action: Action a NO DEAL Brexit and give divorce bill savings directly to UK citizens
attributes.background: This could give a significant boost to the economy as many people would spend it. The Exchequer would therefore receive VAT receipts. Under 18 year olds could have the funds placed in an ISA until they reach the age of 18.
attributes.additional_details: The current estimate of the divorce bill is £40 billion.

attributes.action: Ensure costs for restoring order at HMP Birmingham are met by G4S not taxpayers
attributes.background: In 2011, the running of HM Prison Birmingham was entrusted to outsourcing company G4S. As G4S has failed in its responsibilities, the government should ensure that any costs associated with restoring appropriate conditions at the prison are met by the company and not by the taxpayer.
attributes.additional_details:
The company’s failure to maintain order and provide a safe, habitable environment that will ensure the rehabilitation of inmates, and their return to society has been reported by HM Inspectorate of Prisons www.justiceinspectorates.gov.uk and the prison has now been placed under the control of the Ministry of Justice. 
 
As G4S has been found to have failed in its duty of care to the inmates and staff alike, the Government should take all possible steps to ensure the taxpayer is not penalised for the company’s failure to meet its contractual obligations.

attributes.action: Make statutory adoption leave and pay available for the self employed
attributes.background: Statutory adoption pay and leave is not available to those who are self employed however statutory maternity leave and pay is.  This is discriminatory against those willing and wanting to give the best start to an adopted child by being at home to nurture, care and develop a bond with their child.
attributes.additional_details:
A self employed parent who can biologically have a child can receive statutory maternity leave and pay.  If for whatever reason they have chosen to adopt a child this self employed parent has no rights to adoption pay and leave.  

By leaving self employed adoptive parents to self fund and not work over this leave, it places another barrier to the adoption process.

A prospective adopter will have a strengthened application if they can show how one parent can commit to adoption leave.

attributes.action: Offer African languages from across the continent as formally recognised GCSEs
attributes.background: There are over 15 modern languages offered as a GCSE, however none of the languages offered cover countries across the African continent.
attributes.additional_details:
According the the 2011 census 1.8% of the UK population are Black African and that is set to grow, therefore children of Black African descent should be given the opportunity to achieve a modern language GCSE in their mother tongue.

http://www.voice-online.co.uk/article/2011-census-british-africans-now-dominant-black-group

https://www.mirror.co.uk/news/uk-news/up-a-third-uk-population-3500561

attributes.action: Make calls to the Police non-emergency number 101 free.
attributes.background: Calls to 999 are free, but often these are not urgent. Calls to the NHS 111 are free. The public are encouraged (quite rightly) to report crimes, but are discouraged by the cost. If the Police want the public to report more crimes, and to reduce non-urgent 999 calls, 101 should be a free service.

attributes.action: Ban the use of slug pellets in the UK.
attributes.background: Many pesticides are potentially dangerous to hedgehogs and slug pellets are no exception.  Hedgehogs may eat the pellets, and they are very likely to eat the poisoned slugs and snails. As hedgehogs are an endangered species, pellets should be banned in the UK.
attributes.additional_details:
Hedgehogs are continuing to decline in the UK, according to a new report.Surveys by citizen scientists show hedgehog numbers have fallen by up to 95% since the turn of the century.
Conservation groups say they are particularly concerned about the plight of the hedgehog in towns and rural areas.Slug pellets contribute to this number.Hedgehogs are an endangered species we must do all we can to help these mammals.
There are many natural ways to curb slugs without the need for dangerous pellets.

attributes.action: Make GI labels on foods in stores and restaurant menus a requirement
attributes.background: I suffer from Polycystic Ovarian Syndrome, as 1 in 8 women do across the country. The chronic illness that I have involves a symptom called Insulin Resistance which involves a very restrictive Low GI diet and exercise routine in order to keep manageable. The illness is linked with Type 2 diabetes.
attributes.additional_details: Last year alone, 3.7 million people in the UK were diagnosed with diabetes and it's estimated to rise to 5 million by 2025 if nothing changes. Food is our medicine when it comes to PCOS so I feel like the GI levels being printed on food will help lower the diabetes diagnosis rates in the UK. This is already a requirement in Austriallia: https://www.gisymbol.com/reading-food-labels/

attributes.action: Make minimum wage and benefits the same regardless of age as it’s discrimination
attributes.background: It’s discriminatory for under 25s to get paid less for the same job as someone over 25. Also, if you’re single and under 35, you can only get Housing Benefit for bed-sit accommodation or a single room in shared accommodation.

attributes.action: Fund mental health facilities for Salisbury
attributes.background: There is a serious lack of mental health services and support in Salisbury. This particularly affects full time employed persons who need to pay for treatment because counselling is no longer available on the NHS.
attributes.additional_details: The closest counselling services available for face to face sessions are Melksham, Southampton and Andover. For full time employees, receiving time off work is very difficult. There’s also the cost of paying for travel on top of the sessions. There are regular suicides in our city and people are crying out for some kind of regular service. Services should include DBT and more in depth CBT therapies and classes.

attributes.action: Remove the Home Office exemption from the Data Protection Act
attributes.background: The Home Office has been given an exemption from GDPR and the data protection Act 2018. Citizens have a right to know what is being discussed with regard to their cases and an exemption puts us at risk of more scandals such as windrush.
attributes.additional_details: Citizens should not be denied the right to their data and further exclusions from society.

attributes.action: Help stop the growing violence and murders of Christians in Nigeria
attributes.background: It is estimated that over 16,000 Christians have been killed in Nigeria since 2015. No group has been brought to justice and the scale of these atrocities keeps rising. We need the UK Government to add pressure on the Nigerian govt. to put a stop to these killings before it escalates to war.
attributes.additional_details:
These are links from local news papers and social media 
https://www.vanguardngr.com/2017/06/will-protect-nigerias-northern-christians/
https://www.persecution.org/2018/02/13/report-claims-16000-christians-killed-nigeria-since-2015/
https://www.spectator.co.uk/2017/02/who-will-protect-nigerias-northern-christians/

attributes.action: Ban all non-biodegradable plastic used within the fashion industry
attributes.background: There are estimated 12.7 million tonnes of plastic ends up in the ocean every year. This waste releases toxins, absorbed by animals, subsequently entering the food chain. A ban on non-biodegradable plastic from the fashion industry could limit the micro-plastics that end up in the ocean.
attributes.additional_details:
- Greenpeace (2018). Ocean Plastic. Available at: https://www.greenpeace.org.uk/what-we-do/oceans/plastics/ (Accessed: 30 April 2018).
- Kozlowski, A., Bardecki, M. & Searcy, C., 2012. Environmental Impacts in the Fashion Industry: A Life-cycle and Stakeholder Framework. The Journal of Corporate Citizenship, (45), pp.17–36.
- Seltenrich, N., 2015. New link in the food chain? Marine plastic pollution and seafood safety. Environmental health perspectives, 123(2), pp.A34–41.

attributes.action: We would like the livestock act 1953 to be amended to include alpaca and llama.
attributes.background: Our Alpaca boys were attacked by two lurchers, leaving them traumatised & having to re-home. No prosecution was possible as  the dogs do not fall under the Dangerous Dogs Act 1991, and llamas and alpacas are not protected by the Dogs (Protection of Livestock) Act 1953.
attributes.additional_details: We think this act should be amended to protect these animals.

attributes.action: Require free admission for more than one carer with a disabled client.
attributes.background: As a carer for disabled people it frustrates me when myself and other carers take disabled clients to attractions such as the zoo and are unable to get in as they only allow one carer in for free. A lot of individuals with additional needs have two carers for a reason, not just for show.
attributes.additional_details:
So why should the disabled client, that cannot work, have to pay for the second carer to get in when it's ok for one carer to get in for free. I feel like associations do not realise how much this impacts individuals with additional needs enjoying their lives as they cannot afford it. 
The human rights act 1998 states: 
Right of life 
Freedom of assembly and association 
Protection from discrimination 
Right to education 
 
So why is this a issue in disabled individuals lives on a day to day basis. The Government needs to intervene and make this a legal requirement.

attributes.action: Make chain stores responsible for their plastic packaging, i.e extreme fines
attributes.background:
In every shop you visit how many items are packaged in plastic? 

We need to make chain companies responsible for their plastic input to our environment.
attributes.additional_details:
If the Goverment fines: 
• Super Stores/Markets
• Retail Stores
• Warehouses
• Fast food chains
• Delivery companies 
• etc
For the amount of plastic packaging and waste they produce, the UK should see a decline in plastic packaging; in turn this could lessen the companies fines. With the money that it produces this could go towards companies who break down plastics to recycle them, or in to making any plastic waste in to materials to make roads, for example, instead of using asphalt.

attributes.action: Parliament rule out National Parks and AONBs as sites for nuclear waste disposal
attributes.background: MPs approved a new plan for the UK’s most toxic radioactive materials. The move means protected areas like national parks and areas of outstanding natural beauty (AONB) would be potential sites for waste disposal facilities. We MUST have parliament rule out our national treasures as a dumping ground
attributes.additional_details:
After efforts to find a home for the UK’s nuclear waste stalled, the government launched a new strategy that has since undergone scrutiny by the Business, Energy and Industrial Strategy (BEIS) Committee. After hearing evidence from key stakeholders, the committee has released a report in which they refuse to rule out protected areas as potential dumping sites. - Josh Gabbatiss, Science Correspondent for the Independent.

Ruth Bradshaw, CNP’s policy and research manager, said: “The decision not to recommend excluding national parks and AONBs as possible locations also goes against the government’s ambitions for these areas as set out in the 25-year environment plan."

attributes.action: Encourage Overseas Territories to ensure the rights of LGBT+ people
attributes.background: In almost all, if not all of the British Overseas Territories, LGBT+ residents do not enjoy the same rights LGBT+ people enjoy in mainland Great Britain. While some BOT residents enjoy equal marriage, others have no protection from discrimination, like we have in the UK.
attributes.additional_details: Additionally, transgender identity is not legally recognised in many of our territories. Laws, such as the Gender Recognition Act 2004 and the Equality Act 2010, should be implemented to reflect the values of the UK. If the UK cannot implement these laws, then our government should encourage the territories to conform. Many territories are military bases. The British Military prides itself on openness, diversity and inclusion, so why can't the territories they serve do so too?

attributes.action: Ban building on all greenfield sites.
attributes.background: Builders should only be allowed to build on brownfield sites including over railways, supermarkets, derelict sites. The UK needs to protect all remaining greenfield for food safety and clean air.

attributes.action: Devolve TV Broadcasting to Scottish Government Arts, Culture & Sport Ministry
attributes.background: British broadcasters have neglected their obligation to the people of Scotland, leaving it comparatively invisible in the networks,as there is a "huge accountability-gap" in Scotland as UK Government responsibility lies at Westminster instead of Scottish Government as it is with N. Ireland
attributes.additional_details:
We need to trust our politicians and institutions, devolvement  of television broadcasting would assist the need for transparency and responsibility for localised accountability within Scotland assuring a fairer and more balanced reporting in Scotland and the promotion of the Gaelic Language to Scots. 
At present, Scotland has the lowest proportion of TV Licence Fee to programming collecting £350 million with £89 million set aside for operating costs in Scotland leaving £281 million to go out.

attributes.action: Cut National Citizens Service funding and apply funds to schools and the NHS
attributes.background: In 2017 NCS recieved £180.5 million from the government and has proceeded to spend it on extravagant advertisements instead of the actual service. This money could be better used by schools which constantly face budget cuts and the NHS which is in desperate need of more funding.

attributes.action: Cap the price of UK train fares so they are in line with other major economies
attributes.background: I ask the government to consider taking action against the astronomical train fares facing the British public. We pay significantly more than other major global economies. The train should be a cheaper alternative to driving for the sake of the environment and the future of the planet/mankind.
attributes.additional_details:
According to The Independent we spend "six times more on fares than peers in Europe with 14% of our income being spent on monthly season tickets...significantly higher than the 2% seen in France, 3% in Germany and 4% in Spain."

Fullfact.org says "the cost of an annual season ticket covering long-distance travel can exceed £3000, the equivalent of over £1000 more than the next dearest country: the Netherlands. "

attributes.action: Cut the foreign aid budget by 50% and use this money to save the NHS
attributes.background: Our NHS is in crisis and needs urgent investment. This money would allow for more facilities to be built, more training and recruitment of doctors and nurses, more research and extra mental health provisions. Also, as people are living longer the NHS needs more facilities to help the elderly.
attributes.additional_details: Multiple reports from healthcare experts, RCN, news reports etc all point to our NHS being at breaking point.

attributes.action: Create a Memorial Day for all killed working in emergency services
attributes.background: Many people in the emergency services sadly lose their lives while carrying out their duty. We should create a day to remember them, separate from Remembrance Sunday and other memorial days.
